info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Berks County through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fleetwood, or 11 miles north of Reading, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Birdsboro, Kutztown, Fleetwood, Laureldale, Topton, Shoemakersville, Bally, Bechtelsville, Lyons, Lenhartsville, Gilbertsville, Boyertown, St. Lawrence, Amity Gardens, Lorane and Reiffton. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 38 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
